data.description:
KEY DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:

As a Site Tech Leader, you must be able to lead and provide guidance and supervision to technical support team members from different countries based in Australia, Indonesia, Japan and South Korea and New Zealand as a dispatch site. Strong leadership and communication skills.Strong technical skills supporting user environment, desktop, servers and networking.Must be able to work in a fast phase environment of diverse cultures.Able to work with remote teams based in India, US and Europe providing level 3 support in EUC, Servers and Networking to Oceania businesses.

Roles & Responsibilities

Provide technical support as a point of contact for IT for the site.
End-user desktop, laptops, office IT with smart hand support for network and servers.
Installation support for various software on end-user systems and servers when required
New users onboarding preparing IT assets and tools.
Offboarding support, collecting IT assets and sanitizing IT assets and keep in stock.
Executive / VIP support.
Coordination and remote hand support to backend team for Network & server smart hand support.
IP phone, Video conference support, Level 1 Multifunction Printers support.
Coordinate external vendors when engaged for support.
Work independently and coordinate in-house IT projects.
The engineer should manage most of their time around activities involving BAUs - SLAs, CSAT, Response Time to Client, Average Resolution time, Open incident backlog and maintaining SOP’s and Runbooks for global team use
Should provide technical guidance to Site Tech, prioritization on workload and resource capacity planning
Should be leading the project support team
Asset / stock management / E-Waste, Site Tech Onboarding / Training / Process alignment / Documentation , Onsite Training / User Education , Vendor Co-ordination
Self-disciplined and highly motivated.
Good decision-making skills 
Should be able to prioritise workload based on SLA’s and user impact. 
Configuring, deploying, and troubleshooting enterprise and personal desktop and laptop computers, personal productivity devices, and business applications.
Supporting midrange servers.
Supporting network devices such as switches, routers, and Wireless Apps with the help of the backend team.
Handing tickets on ServiceNow or a similar ticketing system.
Troubleshooting VPN.
Application support with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint) and SharePoint.
Troubleshooting MS Windows 10.
Troubleshooting MS Office 365 issues for end-users.
Office IT Asset Management.
DESIRED SKILLS & EXPERIENCE

 7+ years experience in IT supports demonstrating increasing responsibility and technical expertise in a corporate enterprise environment.
In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Windows 7 and Windows 10 operating systems and their related remote access.
Knowledge & experience with ServiceNow or similar ticketing system.
Understanding of Active Directory.
Familiarity with Microsoft server technologies and their associated user management tools, including Active Directory, Office 365, SharePoint, File, Print, DHCP, and DNS.

data.title: Full Time Computer Network and Systems Engineer
data.description:
Business name: ONCALL Language Services Pty Ltd
Business Address: Level 2, 150 Albert Road, South Melbourne, VIC – 3205

Position Title: Full Time Computer Network and Systems Engineer
Salary: $62,000 plus superannuation 

Tasks include:

•	Investigate, troubleshoot, maintain and control the use of networks (LAN/WAN), servers, workstations, and peripheral devices. 
•	Investigate, install, configure, test and upgrade hardware and software applications, including network equipment. 
•	Install, configure, maintain and control Network Printers and Scanners, Routers and Switches for the smooth business operation.
•	Daily monitor and control performances of computer systems and networks.
•	Install, implement and monitor network traffic and security 
•	Provide necessary support by installing, configuring and providing support for Remote access to the team.
•	Provide remote/onsite troubleshooting and resolving the issues to internal office staffs and clients as per necessity.
•	Work together with the team to evaluate and resolve daily issues.
•	Monitor and control the use of email, web navigation and installed software applications.
•	Install, configure, maintain and monitor routine backup of servers, virtual machines and databases.
•	Monitor Firewalls, Routers, Switches, Access points and Cabling for smooth operation of business
•	Administration and management of servers, VMs, workstations and other software applications.
•	Prepare and maintain the procedure and documentation for network inventory and recording IT and network incidents, their diagnosis and resolutions.
•	Provide critical analysis and problem-solving suggestions to the team, clients and interpreters whenever required.
•	Participate, provide critical analysis and contribute in various IT projects.
•	Install, test, monitor, and pack interpreting equipment and transport the equipment and booths.
•	Responsible for keeping interpreting equipment clean, safe and organised.

Skills Required:
•	Relevant Bachelors or Master Degree 
•	Minimum three years of relevant work experience
•	Deep understanding in Wire and Wireless controllers, Access points, WPA2,
•	Proven experience working in a Systems Administration Assitant / Level 2 Support role preferably within an MSP environment
•	Advanced knowledge of Active Directory, Group Policies, DNS, DHCP and Windows 2012 through 2019
•	Experience in Office 365, Azure and AWS administration is desirable.
•	Excellent knowledge of Networking technologies (switching, routing, VLAN, WLAN, WAN, VPN)
•	Maintaining software updates and version consistency
•	Experience handling large conferences is an added advantage 
•	Knowledge in Wireless and Infrared technologies and equipments
•	Excellent Hands -on knowledge of virtualization is essential (VMware, HyperV, Vsphere preferred)
•	Experience with VOIP tools, online teplohny system (3CX preferred)
•	Experience in firewall both hardware and software (pfsense prefrred)
•	Excellent troubleshooting and resolving ability
•	Experience in regular back up of VMs and Online applications (VEEAM and Handy backup – preferred)


Please send your CV to info@businessnest.com.au

data.title: Business Process Consultant
data.description:
Enable is a pure-play ServiceNow consultancy—100% dedicated to the delivery of ServiceNow advisory, consulting and delivery services. With more than 250 consultants in our ServiceNow practice, we’re the most qualified, certified and capable ServiceNow partner in the APJ region.  

  Our focus is enterprise service management, and we have deep knowledge of and experience in digital and business transformation. Enable has dedicated practices in Customer Service Experience, IT Transformation, Employee Service Experience and Integrated Risk Management. We also have Innovation and Organisational Change Management practices that are intrinsic to everything we do.  

  We are headquartered in Australia, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, and our centre of excellence in India.   

  Role Summary:  

 Consulting roles are exciting and challenging - our customer base ranges across all tier 1 industries and sizes. Engagements vary in length from days to months to years. To be successful in this role, you must present excellent communication skills to work with client stakeholders, client teams and Enablers - both local and remote. You should expect to engage with various clients from commercial to enterprise and have the ability to switch context and customers easily. 

  Main Responsibilities:  

 
	 Leveraging Business Consulting Practice methodologies and consulting intellectual property to achieve business objectives. 
	 Drive high-level specific process definition, re-engineering, improvement and gap analysis of current/to-be processes. 
	 Preparing and running functional and technical design workshops 
	 Ensuring process-related deliverables to customers are complete, consistent, high quality, on time and deliver valued outcomes. 
	 Ownership for completing, developing, and improving required documentation such as process flow diagrams, solutions designs, as-built documentation, roles/responsibilities, workshop agendas, presentations, and gap analysis reports. 
	 Documenting user stories with acute attention to detail, reviewing with stakeholders, gaining acceptance criteria and managing stories throughout the development lifecycle with local and remote teams. 
 

  Skills Matrix:  

 
	 2 years of demonstrated experience across process consulting, definition and deployment of process improvement and systems analysis on ServiceNow platform. 
	 Requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation, solution designs and detailed requirements. 
	 Experience designing process flows for ServiceNow applications 
	 Domain expertise in IT Service Management. 
	 Experience using ServiceNow Agile Development and managing SCRUM calls and Agile processes. 
 

  Qualifications & Certifications:  

 ·        IT Degree or relevant tertiary education in Computer Science 

 ·        ServiceNow CSA + CIS ITSM 

 ·        ITIL Foundation Certified 

 ·        PMP and/or Agile Scrum certificates

data.title: Technical Support Specialist: Printing
data.description:
GJS is a dynamic, Australian-owned business headquartered in Revesby and we’re currently looking for an experienced, self-motivated and customer-focused person to join our support team as a Technical Support Specialist in Queensland.

We have a passion for our people and are proud of our fast-paced, high-energy, team-orientated environment, so to land this role you’ll need to have the following skills:

- Previous experience servicing and supporting digital equipment
- Background in electronics
- Valid driver’s licence
- Excellent verbal communication and customer service skills
- Highly organised, efficient time management and reliable
- High attention to detail and quality focus
- Professional personal presentation
- Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite

**Bonus points if you also have**

- Previous experience within the digital printer market
- Familiarity with Salesforce Service Cloud/Field Service Lightning
- Familiarity with SAP Business One
- Familiarity with Adobe Creative Suite of graphics software

What you’ll be doing each day:
- Providing remote and/or on-site technical support to ensure GJS customers can enjoy maximum up-time and production
- Hitting the road and installing new printing equipment
- Remote and on-site product training for GJS customers
- On-site scheduled servicing of existing GJS printer install base
- Assisting the sales and customer services teams in maintaining GJS' exceptional customer service standards
- Develop and maintain all support and service process documentation and the GJS knowledgebase

The perks!
-  Competitive salary and benefits
-  Work for a funky, dynamic business that embraces new technology and is disrupting its industry
- Young management with progressive ideas
- All product training provided
- Immediate start

Working Hours:
- Monday to Friday: 8am?4.30pm

GJS is a fun, supportive and equal opportunity employer where we are giving the right person the opportunity to be trained, learn about our exciting industry and become part of our vibrant, energetic and growing team.

How to apply:
If this is you, then please submit a copy of your CV with an accompanying cover letter detailing how your professional experience makes you the best choice for this role and also answers the following questions:

- If you were a cocktail, what would you be and why?

Only applications with accompanying cover letters that answer the above questions will be considered.

Salary: $50,000.00 – $65,000.00 per year + vehicle allowance

data.title: Technical Lead - Performance
data.description:
Join us on our mission to make a better world of work ??

Culture Amp revolutionises how over 25 million employees across 5,000 companies create a better world of work. As the global platform leader for employee experience, we empower companies of all sizes and industries to transform employee engagement, develop high performing teams, and retain talent via cutting-edge research, powerful technology, and the largest employee dataset IN THE WORLD! The most innovative companies across the globe, such as Salesforce, Unilever, PwC, Coles, Slack, and BigCommerce depend on Culture Amp every day.

Culture Amp is backed by 10 years of innovation, leading capital venture funds, and offices in the US, UK, and Australia. We’re recognised as one of the world’s top private cloud companies by Forbes and one of the most innovative workplace companies by Fast Company.

Learn more about how Culture Amp can help you create a better world of work on our website.

How you can help make a better world of work

We currently have an opening for a Technical Lead to lead a team in our Careers camp working on our Performance product. This camp has multiple teams tasked with creating transformative people-first performance reviews that are growth focussed, fair and equitable, and inspire action. Captured in a platform that is easy to use, connected and scalable.

Your role will be to provide confident technical and people leadership, empowering and enabling your engineers to achieve a high standard of technical excellence. You will be working both hands-on and hands-off, guiding outcomes that align towards our technical vision, coaching the team towards robust system architecture, their technology choices, implementation details, and product quality. As part of this team of amazing humans…

You will...

Bring your passion for innovation and architectural fundamentals to support your team to craft and share compelling solutions with peers and stakeholders
Take accountability for your engineering approach and how your team ships product
Collaborate closely with your leadership team to improve your team’s performance and deliverables.
Match your engineers with opportunities that offer them growth, while fostering a safe and collaborative environment
You have...

Previously led a high performance engineering team and worked closely with other leaders
Proven track record in systems design
Experience engaging with stakeholders
The ability to evaluate and draw intelligent conclusions
Experience working across the stack and not perturbed by legacy systems
You are...

An empathetic people leader who can naturally balance hands-on tasks and coaching individuals
A passionate supporter of high quality, scaleable architecture
An effective communicator both within your team and with external stakeholders 
We want you to thrive both in and out of work, so we offer...

Fully remote working options from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand
Flexible working schedule to fit in with other commitments
Active career growth and development support
Home office budget for remote working
Highly inclusive workplace with a keen focus on employee well-being
Excellent parental leave and in work support programme
Comprehensive remuneration package, including share options - making you an owner so you can share in Culture Amp’s success
A job where you are making a positive difference to millions of people’s lives! ??
We believe that inclusive businesses are better, not just for ‘company results’, but for the world. We have a strong commitment to Anti-Racism, and endeavour to lead by example. Every step we make as a business towards anti-racism is another step we can take to support our customers in making a better world (of work). You can see our current commitments to Anti-Racism here.

Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike the of majority candidates meeting significantly fewer requirements. If this applies to you - we strongly encourage you to apply. ??

data.title: Systems Support Consultant
data.description:
Systemnet is an unique IT infrastructure services company based in Sydney. 
Systemnet, together with our partners, are dedicated to providing our clients with an effective, efficient and responsive outsourced IT infrastructure service and innovative solutions. 

Systemnet prides itself with the relationships it has fostered over the last 25 years with its clients, suppliers and team members. We aim to provide you with a challenging and rewarding environment, in which you may develop your professional skills and simultaneously enhance the success of Systemnet, its team and our clients. 

Systemnet is not product centric and will evaluate all options when recommending solutions to our clients. This creates an opportunity for you to explore new ideas and introduce these new solutions to the business.

About the role: 

The focus is on business IT systems and the responsibilities include design, implementation, maintenance and support of Local Area and Wide Area networks.

You will:

Provide Managed IT Services to corporate clients across a broad range of industry sectors. Your support will be offered remotely and onsite.
You will be working on exciting implementation projects which will involve ‘on premises’ and/or cloud installations and migrations.
Design new LAN and WAN IT system configurations.
Research and utilising your analytical skills evaluate the performance of operational environments with the objective of improving performance, security and redundancy.
Document and enforce Systemnet standards.
Maximise network performance by monitoring performance and troubleshooting problems and outages on the local and wide area network.
Using Network monitoring and analysis tools from SolarWinds use your skills and experience to identify, evaluate and resolve issues quickly and efficiently,
Schedule and manage system software upgrades and patch management of core devices.
Utilising multiple sources for information, investigate and resolve network faults while communicating the status of the issues to the client and internal management.
Secure network systems by establishing and enforcing security policies and implementation of security devices and software.
Monitor, administer, upgrade and configure firewall environments.
Monitor and ensure firmware on wide area network devices are up to date.
Manage a configuration of 60+ firewall clusters dispersed across the Asia Pacific region.
Configuration of routers and switching equipment for voice and data services.
Telephone and on-site support/troubleshooting for customers and other Systemnet engineers.
Remote technical support to local and international clients.
Hardware & Software Support
Liaise with project managers, sales consultants, IT software and hardware vendors in order to deliver cost effective IT solutions.
Client systems management

Benefits and perks:

Great learning and career development opportunities
Inner city working environment
Team-focused environment
Flexibility, eg working from home on certain days

Skills and experience:

It is essential that you have excellent English oral and written communication skills.
You will need to be able to provide both remote and onsite support.
You must be able to interact confidently at all levels within an organisation.
IT experience or relevant IT qualifications
Worked with Server platforms
Knowledge of Server Virtualisation technologies from Microsoft and VMWare
Familiarity with Cloud technologies such as Office 365, Azure and AWS
Worked with disaster recovery products such as Veeam
Knowledge of security technologies from vendors such as Watchguard and Cisco
Familiarity with all the usual network infrastructure technologies such as routers, switches, and Wi-Fi
Willingness and ability to participate in a 24x7 phone support roster.
You will also need to have a valid visa to work and live in Australia

data.title: Desktop Support Engineer
data.description:
Daily Mail Australia forms part of a phenomenal global offering attracting over 250 million readers world-wide across our award-winning newspapers, websites and apps - making it the world's largest English-speaking news website. We are consistently breaking exclusives in local and global news, celebrity, entertainment and sport while reporting on what's trending in fashion, beauty, health and technology.

We are looking for a Desktop Support Engineer to join our four-person team based in Sydney. You will act as the first point of contact for all technical related queries for all company users and apply your knowledge, logic and research techniques to solve technical issues. 

The successful candidate will work remotely but there may be occasional travel required. 


Key Responsibilities:

Providing 1st/2nd line support for onsite/remote users
Answering walk-ups, phone queries and emails from staff at all levels of the business
Supporting VIP users including the Managing Editors office and the Editor
Administration of all company IT equipment including laptops, desktops and mobile devices
Asset management of all company IT equipment
Ensuring support team SLA’s are achieved
User account creation and access/role management
Build management, imaging and software deployments via SCCM 2012 and Jamf Pro
Liaising with our global Tech teams to provide a high level of service to end users
Investigating and analysing incidents through to root cause
Ensuring internal Daily Mail applications achieve maximum uptime, availability and performance
Providing support and training of both bespoke and off the shelf applications
Monitoring and implementing IT security policies
Deploying/upgrading hardware and software as required
Maintaining a strong working relationship with all external partners, vendors and internal teams
Maintaining working knowledge of all computer related systems and software to facilitate troubleshooting and repairs
Creation and management of technical documentation
Keeping abreast of new computer-related technology that will assist Daily Mail Australia
Attending training courses when required to do so
Managing your time effectively under pressure
Performing other related duties as required

Key Skills/Qualifications

Hardware/software installation and troubleshooting
Remote support software (TeamViewer, LogMeIn, Splashtop, VNC)
Demonstrable experience with supporting Windows and macOS operating systems
Experience with ticket triaging and strong understanding of ticket management processes
Experience working with Microsoft technologies (O365, Teams, SharePoint, OneDrive, Azure and Exchange)
Active directory administration via Quest ActiveRoles Server/Azure AD
SCCM 2012 image/software deployment
Experience with Apple MDM tools (Jamf Pro)
Experience with identity and access management solutions
FTP software including Filezilla and SmartFTP
Basic networking skills – TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VPNs
Excellent documentation skills
Strong written and oral communication skills and a keen attention for detail

Desirable: 

Experience with Linux/Ubuntu operating systems
MS security products (InTune, Defender, ATP)
Zendesk/Service Now ticketing systems
Atlassian products (Jira/Confluence)
Virtualisation technologies including VMWare, Parallels and Oracle VM Virtual Box
Experience with CDN management (AWS/Akamai)
HTML/CSS/SQL/Bash/Python
Understanding of ITIL/Agile methodologies

Annual Base Salary between: $60,000 to $70,000 + Super

data.title: DevOps Engineer - Developer Platform  - Open to Remote across ANZ
data.description:
At Canva, we’re transforming the way the world designs. Canva's user base has grown by over 10x over the last 2 years, and serves millions of users every single month, in over 100 languages, and across web and mobile platforms.  In order to ensure high availability, top-notch performance, and the continued scalability of the environment as Canva grows, we've decided to grow our Infrastructure Group.  We're seeking self-motivated and talented engineers to join us. 

   

 Stable, scalable, and well-maintained systems are the foundations of our development and design processes.  The developer efficiency team’s mission is to empower any engineer to develop and ship awesome features with the highest efficiency and quality.  We do this by building infrastructure tools and processes that facilitate the entire development life-cycle.  This includes our CI systems, build tools, IDE workflows, source control, and more.  The mission of this role is to maintain and improve our internal tools so that developers working at Canva have a delightful developer experience. 

   

 Responsibilities 

 
	 Work to improve/maintain internal developer experience platforms that empower engineers to work efficiently. 
	 Work across CI, Static Analysis Tooling, IDE Integration (Bazel) and other developer-related domains as necessary to ensure Canva’s engineering teams continue to scale with the demands of the product suite 
	 Develop self-service infrastructure from the ground up to empower our engineering teams to work more efficiently 
	 Communicate with other teams to figure out the best solutions to their problems 
	 Participate in design meetings, interviews, and code reviews 
	 Propose new approaches and solutions to ensure we future-proof Canva's distributed cloud infrastructure as we scale up 
	 Be invariably passionate about performance debugging, benchmarking, building awesome things, and picking up new technologies and skills 
 

 Required Experience 

 
	 As a DevOps/ Software Engineer, have experience building internal tooling for CI, infrastructure, or developer efficiency/productivity 
	 Advanced coding proficiency in Python/ Java/golang  
	 Experience with containers, Docker, Kubernetes 
	 An understanding of the DevOps ecosystem concerning tooling, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, Infrastructure as Code 
	 Experience working in Linux cloud-based services in AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure 
	 Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong soft skills when managing both technical and non-technical stakeholders 
	 Be self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership over complex problems and their related solutions

About the Company:
5G Networks (5GN) is a licenced telecommunications carrier operating across Australia. Our vision is to be Australia’s partner of choice for unifying a seamless digital experience for our customers across data connectivity, cloud and data centre services, all underpinned by our expert managed services.

The Role
As a Support Engineer you will be responsible for providing fault resolution, escalation and maintenance services to our customers. Supporting them both onsite and remotely, you will install and maintain computer hardware, software and networks. Using your ability to develop relationships across the organisation, you'll provide support to clients across a wide range of platforms and technologies.

We are a lean and mean local team so you'll be working at full tilt most of the time, but you'll have a new challenge every day and will be a part of a national team of 100+ engineers.

Enable is a pure-play ServiceNow consultancy—100% dedicated to the delivery of ServiceNow advisory, consulting and delivery services. With more than 250 consultants in our ServiceNow practice, we’re the most qualified, certified and capable ServiceNow partner in the APJ region.

Enable has dedicated practices in Customer Service Experience, IT Transformation, Employee Service Experience and Integrated Risk Management. We also have Innovation and Organisational Change Management practices that are intrinsic to everything we do.  

  We are headquartered in Australia, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, and our centre of excellence in India.   

  Role Summary:  

 Consulting roles are exciting and challenging - our customer base ranges across all tier 1 industries and sizes. Engagements vary in length from days to months to years. To be successful in this role, you must present excellent communication skills to work with client stakeholders, client teams and Enablers - both local and remote. You should expect to engage with various clients from commercial to enterprise and have the ability to switch context and customers easily. 

  Main Responsibilities:  

 
	 Leveraging Business Consulting Practice methodologies and consulting intellectual property to achieve business objectives.

	 Preparing and running functional and technical design workshops 
	 Ensuring process-related deliverables to customers are complete, consistent, high quality, on time and deliver valued outcomes. 
	 Ownership for completing, developing, and improving required documentation such as process flow diagrams, solutions designs, as-built documentation, roles/responsibilities, workshop agendas, presentations, and gap analysis reports. 
	 Documenting user stories with acute attention to detail, reviewing with stakeholders, gaining acceptance criteria and managing stories throughout the development lifecycle with local and remote teams. 
 

  Skills Matrix:  

 
	 2 years of demonstrated experience across process consulting, definition and deployment of process improvement and systems analysis on ServiceNow platform. 
	 Requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation, solution designs and detailed requirements. 
	 Experience designing process flows for ServiceNow applications 
	 Domain expertise in IT Service Management. 
	 Experience using ServiceNow Agile Development and managing SCRUM calls and Agile processes.

data.title: Systems Support Consultant
data.description:
Systemnet is an unique IT infrastructure services company based in Sydney. 
Systemnet, together with our partners, are dedicated to providing our clients with an effective, efficient and responsive outsourced IT infrastructure service and innovative solutions. 

Systemnet prides itself with the relationships it has fostered over the last 25 years with its clients, suppliers and team members. We aim to provide you with a challenging and rewarding environment, in which you may develop your professional skills and simultaneously enhance the success of Systemnet, its team and our clients. 

Systemnet is not product centric and will evaluate all options when recommending solutions to our clients. This creates an opportunity for you to explore new ideas and introduce these new solutions to the business.

About the role: 

The focus is on business IT systems and the responsibilities include design, implementation, maintenance and support of Local Area and Wide Area networks.

You will:

Provide Managed IT Services to corporate clients across a broad range of industry sectors. Your support will be offered remotely and onsite.
You will be working on exciting implementation projects which will involve ‘on premises’ and/or cloud installations and migrations.
Design new LAN and WAN IT system configurations.
Research and utilising your analytical skills evaluate the performance of operational environments with the objective of improving performance, security and redundancy.
Document and enforce Systemnet standards.
Maximise network performance by monitoring performance and troubleshooting problems and outages on the local and wide area network.
Using Network monitoring and analysis tools from SolarWinds use your skills and experience to identify, evaluate and resolve issues quickly and efficiently,
Schedule and manage system software upgrades and patch management of core devices.
Utilising multiple sources for information, investigate and resolve network faults while communicating the status of the issues to the client and internal management.
Secure network systems by establishing and enforcing security policies and implementation of security devices and software.
Monitor, administer, upgrade and configure firewall environments.
Monitor and ensure firmware on wide area network devices are up to date.
Manage a configuration of 60+ firewall clusters dispersed across the Asia Pacific region.
Configuration of routers and switching equipment for voice and data services.
Telephone and on-site support/troubleshooting for customers and other Systemnet engineers.
Remote technical support to local and international clients.
Hardware & Software Support
Liaise with project managers, sales consultants, IT software and hardware vendors in order to deliver cost effective IT solutions.
Client systems management

Benefits and perks:

Great learning and career development opportunities
Inner city working environment
Team-focused environment
Flexibility, eg working from home on certain days

Skills and experience:

It is essential that you have excellent English oral and written communication skills.
You will need to be able to provide both remote and onsite support.
You must be able to interact confidently at all levels within an organisation.
IT experience or relevant IT qualifications
Worked with Server platforms
Knowledge of Server Virtualisation technologies from Microsoft and VMWare
Familiarity with Cloud technologies such as Office 365, Azure and AWS
Worked with disaster recovery products such as Veeam
Knowledge of security technologies from vendors such as Watchguard and Cisco
Familiarity with all the usual network infrastructure technologies such as routers, switches, and Wi-Fi
Willingness and ability to participate in a 24x7 phone support roster.
You will also need to have a valid visa to work and live in Australia

 Stable, scalable, and well-maintained systems are the foundations of our development and design processes.  The developer efficiency team’s mission is to empower any engineer to develop and ship awesome features with the highest efficiency and quality.  We do this by building infrastructure tools and processes that facilitate the entire development life-cycle.  This includes our CI systems, build tools, IDE workflows, source control, and more.  The mission of this role is to maintain and improve our internal tools so that developers working at Canva have a delightful developer experience.

 Required Experience

As a Support Engineer you will be responsible for providing fault resolution, escalation and maintenance services to our customers. Supporting them both onsite and remotely, you will install and maintain computer hardware, software and networks. Using your ability to develop relationships across the organisation, you'll provide support to clients across a wide range of platforms and technologies.

We are a lean and mean local team so you'll be working at full tilt most of the time, but you'll have a new challenge every day and will be a part of a national team of 100+ engineers.

Title: Support Engineer
Occupation: ICT Support Engineer
Salary: $65,000 - $79,999 (depending on experience) plus super 
Company: Webcentral
Location: Melbourne
Hours: Full time 38 hours per week
Experience Required: min 2 years in relevant role
Visa Sponsorship: Nomination for temporary work visa and/or Permanent Residency will be considered for eligible candidates.
Duties: Some of the duties you will be required to perform include
•	Assisting with fault escalation and resolution.
•	Contribute to the delivery and documentation of customer projects.
•	Configure, deploy and administer LAN, WAN, security and remote access technologies.
•	Support customers with a wide variety of platforms and technologies.
•	Build and configure desktops, servers and storage networking hardware.
•	Provide exceptional customer service.

PLEASE NOTE: Only successful candidates will receive a reply. Applicants who contact the employer directly or submit applications outside of this online portal will not be considered.

data.title: Business Process Consultant
data.description:
Enable is a pure-play ServiceNow consultancy—100% dedicated to the delivery of ServiceNow advisory, consulting and delivery services. With more than 250 consultants in our ServiceNow practice, we’re the most qualified, certified and capable ServiceNow partner in the APJ region.  

  Our focus is enterprise service management, and we have deep knowledge of and experience in digital and business transformation. Enable has dedicated practices in Customer Service Experience, IT Transformation, Employee Service Experience and Integrated Risk Management. We also have Innovation and Organisational Change Management practices that are intrinsic to everything we do.  

  We are headquartered in Australia, with offices in Singapore, Hong Kong, Thailand, Malaysia, and our centre of excellence in India.   

  Role Summary:  

 Consulting roles are exciting and challenging - our customer base ranges across all tier 1 industries and sizes. Engagements vary in length from days to months to years. To be successful in this role, you must present excellent communication skills to work with client stakeholders, client teams and Enablers - both local and remote. You should expect to engage with various clients from commercial to enterprise and have the ability to switch context and customers easily. 

  Main Responsibilities:  

 
	 Leveraging Business Consulting Practice methodologies and consulting intellectual property to achieve business objectives. 
	 Drive high-level specific process definition, re-engineering, improvement and gap analysis of current/to-be processes. 
	 Preparing and running functional and technical design workshops 
	 Ensuring process-related deliverables to customers are complete, consistent, high quality, on time and deliver valued outcomes. 
	 Ownership for completing, developing, and improving required documentation such as process flow diagrams, solutions designs, as-built documentation, roles/responsibilities, workshop agendas, presentations, and gap analysis reports. 
	 Documenting user stories with acute attention to detail, reviewing with stakeholders, gaining acceptance criteria and managing stories throughout the development lifecycle with local and remote teams. 
 

  Skills Matrix:  

 
	 2 years of demonstrated experience across process consulting, definition and deployment of process improvement and systems analysis on ServiceNow platform. 
	 Requirements gathering, including experience in creating process documentation, solution designs and detailed requirements. 
	 Experience designing process flows for ServiceNow applications 
	 Domain expertise in IT Service Management. 
	 Experience using ServiceNow Agile Development and managing SCRUM calls and Agile processes. 
 

  Qualifications & Certifications:  

 ·        IT Degree or relevant tertiary education in Computer Science 

 ·        ServiceNow CSA + CIS ITSM 

 ·        ITIL Foundation Certified 

 ·        PMP and/or Agile Scrum certificates

data.title: Systems Support Consultant
data.description:
Systemnet is an unique IT infrastructure services company based in Sydney. 
Systemnet, together with our partners, are dedicated to providing our clients with an effective, efficient and responsive outsourced IT infrastructure service and innovative solutions. 

Systemnet prides itself with the relationships it has fostered over the last 25 years with its clients, suppliers and team members. We aim to provide you with a challenging and rewarding environment, in which you may develop your professional skills and simultaneously enhance the success of Systemnet, its team and our clients. 

Systemnet is not product centric and will evaluate all options when recommending solutions to our clients. This creates an opportunity for you to explore new ideas and introduce these new solutions to the business.

About the role: 

The focus is on business IT systems and the responsibilities include design, implementation, maintenance and support of Local Area and Wide Area networks.

You will:

Provide Managed IT Services to corporate clients across a broad range of industry sectors. Your support will be offered remotely and onsite.
You will be working on exciting implementation projects which will involve ‘on premises’ and/or cloud installations and migrations.
Design new LAN and WAN IT system configurations.
Research and utilising your analytical skills evaluate the performance of operational environments with the objective of improving performance, security and redundancy.
Document and enforce Systemnet standards.
Maximise network performance by monitoring performance and troubleshooting problems and outages on the local and wide area network.
Using Network monitoring and analysis tools from SolarWinds use your skills and experience to identify, evaluate and resolve issues quickly and efficiently,
Schedule and manage system software upgrades and patch management of core devices.
Utilising multiple sources for information, investigate and resolve network faults while communicating the status of the issues to the client and internal management.
Secure network systems by establishing and enforcing security policies and implementation of security devices and software.
Monitor, administer, upgrade and configure firewall environments.
Monitor and ensure firmware on wide area network devices are up to date.
Manage a configuration of 60+ firewall clusters dispersed across the Asia Pacific region.
Configuration of routers and switching equipment for voice and data services.
Telephone and on-site support/troubleshooting for customers and other Systemnet engineers.
Remote technical support to local and international clients.
Hardware & Software Support
Liaise with project managers, sales consultants, IT software and hardware vendors in order to deliver cost effective IT solutions.
Client systems management

Benefits and perks:

Great learning and career development opportunities
Inner city working environment
Team-focused environment
Flexibility, eg working from home on certain days

Skills and experience:

It is essential that you have excellent English oral and written communication skills.
You will need to be able to provide both remote and onsite support.
You must be able to interact confidently at all levels within an organisation.
IT experience or relevant IT qualifications
Worked with Server platforms
Knowledge of Server Virtualisation technologies from Microsoft and VMWare
Familiarity with Cloud technologies such as Office 365, Azure and AWS
Worked with disaster recovery products such as Veeam
Knowledge of security technologies from vendors such as Watchguard and Cisco
Familiarity with all the usual network infrastructure technologies such as routers, switches, and Wi-Fi
Willingness and ability to participate in a 24x7 phone support roster.
You will also need to have a valid visa to work and live in Australia

data.title: DevOps Engineer - Developer Platform  - Open to Remote across ANZ
data.description:
At Canva, we’re transforming the way the world designs. Canva's user base has grown by over 10x over the last 2 years, and serves millions of users every single month, in over 100 languages, and across web and mobile platforms.  In order to ensure high availability, top-notch performance, and the continued scalability of the environment as Canva grows, we've decided to grow our Infrastructure Group.  We're seeking self-motivated and talented engineers to join us. 

   

 Stable, scalable, and well-maintained systems are the foundations of our development and design processes.  The developer efficiency team’s mission is to empower any engineer to develop and ship awesome features with the highest efficiency and quality.  We do this by building infrastructure tools and processes that facilitate the entire development life-cycle.  This includes our CI systems, build tools, IDE workflows, source control, and more.  The mission of this role is to maintain and improve our internal tools so that developers working at Canva have a delightful developer experience. 

   

 Responsibilities 

 
	 Work to improve/maintain internal developer experience platforms that empower engineers to work efficiently. 
	 Work across CI, Static Analysis Tooling, IDE Integration (Bazel) and other developer-related domains as necessary to ensure Canva’s engineering teams continue to scale with the demands of the product suite 
	 Develop self-service infrastructure from the ground up to empower our engineering teams to work more efficiently 
	 Communicate with other teams to figure out the best solutions to their problems 
	 Participate in design meetings, interviews, and code reviews 
	 Propose new approaches and solutions to ensure we future-proof Canva's distributed cloud infrastructure as we scale up 
	 Be invariably passionate about performance debugging, benchmarking, building awesome things, and picking up new technologies and skills 
 

 Required Experience 

 
	 As a DevOps/ Software Engineer, have experience building internal tooling for CI, infrastructure, or developer efficiency/productivity 
	 Advanced coding proficiency in Python/ Java/golang  
	 Experience with containers, Docker, Kubernetes 
	 An understanding of the DevOps ecosystem concerning tooling, Continuous Delivery, Continuous Integration, Infrastructure as Code 
	 Experience working in Linux cloud-based services in AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure 
	 Excellent verbal and written communication skills; strong soft skills when managing both technical and non-technical stakeholders 
	 Be self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership over complex problems and their related solutions

data.title: Support Engineer
data.description:
About the Company:
5G Networks (5GN) is a licenced telecommunications carrier operating across Australia. Our vision is to be Australia’s partner of choice for unifying a seamless digital experience for our customers across data connectivity, cloud and data centre services, all underpinned by our expert managed services.

The Role
As a Support Engineer you will be responsible for providing fault resolution, escalation and maintenance services to our customers. Supporting them both onsite and remotely, you will install and maintain computer hardware, software and networks. Using your ability to develop relationships across the organisation, you'll provide support to clients across a wide range of platforms and technologies.

We are a lean and mean local team so you'll be working at full tilt most of the time, but you'll have a new challenge every day and will be a part of a national team of 100+ engineers.

Title: Support Engineer
Occupation: ICT Support Engineer
Salary: $65,000 - $79,999 (depending on experience) plus super 
Company: Webcentral
Location: Melbourne
Hours: Full time 38 hours per week
Experience Required: min 2 years in relevant role
Visa Sponsorship: Nomination for temporary work visa and/or Permanent Residency will be considered for eligible candidates.
Duties: Some of the duties you will be required to perform include
•	Assisting with fault escalation and resolution.
•	Contribute to the delivery and documentation of customer projects.
•	Configure, deploy and administer LAN, WAN, security and remote access technologies.
•	Support customers with a wide variety of platforms and technologies.
•	Build and configure desktops, servers and storage networking hardware.
•	Provide exceptional customer service.

PLEASE NOTE: Only successful candidates will receive a reply. Applicants who contact the employer directly or submit applications outside of this online portal will not be considered.

data.title: Technical Lead
data.description:
Join us on our mission to make a better world of work ??

Culture Amp revolutionises how over 25 million employees across 5,000 companies create a better world of work. As the global platform leader for employee experience, we empower companies of all sizes and industries to transform employee engagement, develop high performing teams, and retain talent via cutting-edge research, powerful technology, and the largest employee dataset IN THE WORLD! The most innovative companies across the globe, such as Salesforce, Unilever, PwC, Coles, Slack, and BigCommerce depend on Culture Amp every day.

Culture Amp is backed by 10 years of innovation, leading capital venture funds, and offices in the US, UK, and Australia. We’re recognised as one of the world’s top private cloud companies by Forbes and one of the most innovative workplace companies by Fast Company.

Learn more about how Culture Amp can help you create a better world of work on our website.

How you can help make a better world of work

We currently have an opening for a Technical Lead to support and grow our an Engineering Team, which sits within one of our Engineering Camps.

Your role will be to help nurture and grow skilled engineers by coaching, mentoring and supporting your engineers. You will be working both hands-on and hands-off, with our technical vision as your target. You will coach your team to create world-class system architecture, make smart technology choices and deliver best-in-class product quality. As part of this team of amazing humans…

You will...

Bring your passion for innovation and architectural fundamentals to support your team in crafting compelling solutions
Take accountability for your engineering approach and how your team ships product
Collaborate closely with your leadership team to improve your team’s performance and deliverables.
Match your engineers with opportunities that offer them growth, while fostering a safe and collaborative environment
You have...

Previously helped lead a high performance engineering team
Proven track record in systems design
Experience engaging with stakeholders
The ability to evaluate large or complex problems and decompose into smaller iterable components
You are...

An empathetic technical leader who can naturally balance hands-on tasks and coaching individuals
An avid supporter of high quality, scalable architecture
An effective communicator both within your team and with external stakeholders 
We want you to thrive both in and out of work, so we offer...

Fully remote working options from anywhere in Australia or New Zealand
Flexible working schedule to fit in with other commitments
Active career growth and development support
Home office budget for remote working
Highly inclusive workplace with a keen focus on employee well-being
Excellent parental leave and in work support programme
Comprehensive remuneration package, including share options - making you an owner so you can share in Culture Amp’s success
A job where you are making a positive difference to millions of people’s lives! ??
We believe that inclusive businesses are better, not just for ‘company results’, but for the world. We have a strong commitment to Anti-Racism, and endeavour to lead by example. Every step we make as a business towards anti-racism is another step we can take to support our customers in making a better world (of work). You can see our current commitments to Anti-Racism here.

Research shows that candidates from underrepresented backgrounds often don't apply for roles if they don't meet all the criteria – unlike the of majority candidates meeting significantly fewer requirements. If this applies to you - we strongly encourage you to apply. ??

Input into the areas related to Asset & Billing

The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Excellent documentation skills.
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.

Excellent planning, organisational, and time management skills.
